content.description: International migration in the late twentieth century illustrates many important geographic principles.
content.question:
Directions: You have 25 minutes to answer the following question. It is suggested that you take up to 5 minutes of this time to plan and outline each answer. While a formal essay is not required, it is not enough to answer a question by merely listing facts. Illustrate your answers with substantive geographic examples where appropriate.

Define each of the following principles.

core-periphery

distance decay

chain migration

For each principle in part A, select a migration stream identified by letter on the map above, and discuss how the stream you choose illustrates the principle. Note: Each lettered migration stream may be used only once.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe geographic concepts, processes, models, and theories.
